info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 5:44PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN PREBLE, NORTHEASTERN BUTLER AND WESTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 544 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Seven Mile, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, pea size hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Trotwood, Miamisburg, Trenton, Moraine, West Carrollton, West Alexandria, Gratis, Seven Mile, Clayton, Brookville, Germantown, New Lebanon, Farmersville, West Elkton, Jacksonburg, Poast Town Heights, Drexel and Pyrmont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
